page.title: 05Health Care -Amberley
page.content: Amberley village has a doctor's surgery provided by and financed by local residents. National Health Service Doctors from Arundel and pulborough hold surgeries here three times a week. When home visits are necessary Doctors come from these towns. Residents requiring hospital care are sent to either Chichester or Worthing hospitals. District Nurses are attached to local Doctors and operate from their main surgeries. When village residents require their services they travel by car, often quite long distances, to their patients own homes. Doctors recommend their house-bound patients for Meal on Wheels service. Hot mid-day meals are delivered by volunteers (some from this village). A chiropodist attends the village surgery
